pageContext.claim: “This was an Illegally Started Hoax that never should have happened, a... ....big, fat, waste of time, energy and money - $30,000,000 to be exact. It is now finally time to turn the tables and bring justice to some very sick and dangerous people who have committed very serious crimes, perhaps even Spying or Treason. This should never happen again!”
pageContext.analysis: Mueller reported $25.2 million in direct and indirect costs through September 2018, a total that will likely increase when the final months' costs are tallied. Mueller also made money for the government, namely by seizing properties and assets from former Trump campaign chairman Paul Manafort that could well defease the entire cost of his investigation in the final accounting. Trump falsely claims that the Russia investigation had an "illegal" origin. But his own appointee, Deputy Attorney General Rod Rosenstein, authorized the special counsel investigation and selected Robert Mueller to lead it. Multiple judges upheld Mueller's appointment. Trump calls it a witch hunt, but Mueller indicted numerous individuals, including Manafort. Trump calls it "perhaps even Spying" and also suggests it was "treason," a crime punishable by death, but those claims are unfounded.
